Whether you're a new player entering Sumeru or a veteran looking for a consistent Dendro enabler without spending Primogems, the Dendro Traveler is an excellent and free option who punches well above their weight and scales nicely into even the highest-tier team compositions.

question: Tell me about Electro traveler
answer: The Electro Traveler is the Electro-aligned version of the Traveler character, unlocked in *Genshin Impact* after interacting with the Statue of the Seven in Inazuma. While not as flashy as five-star characters, Electro Traveler offers a unique support and battery-focused playstyle that can be quite useful in certain team comps, especially for players looking for reliable Energy Recharge solutions or who are still building out their roster. This version of the Traveler emphasizes consistent Electro application, Energy regeneration, and moderate off-field damage. The Electro Traveler’s playstyle revolves around generating energy and applying Electro damage to support teammates, especially those who have high energy demands. Their Elemental Skill, **Lightning Blade**, unleashes multiple swift strikes that deal Electro damage and generate Abundance Amulets, which, when collected by active characters, restore Energy. This makes them a very effective battery, particularly for other Electro units like Raiden Shogun, Beidou, or Yae Miko. The skill is fast and has a short cooldown, meaning it can be used frequently to both deal damage and sustain team rotations. Their Elemental Burst, **Bellowing Thunder**, summons a thunderous eye that follows the active character. When characters deal Normal or Charged Attack damage, the eye will deal coordinated Electro attacks, acting similarly to other off-field skills like Fischl’s Oz, though with a shorter duration and more modest damage. This Burst is great for sustained Electro application, enabling consistent Electro-related reactions like Overload, Electro-Charged, or Superconduct, depending on the rest of your team. Team-wise, Electro Traveler pairs best in compositions that benefit from energy regeneration or need a reliable off-field Electro applicator. They’re especially helpful in teams where another character has high energy cost abilities and needs consistent energy generation—such as Burst-heavy characters like Eula or Raiden. Because their kit doesn’t rely on heavy stats or hard-to-obtain gear, they can also serve as a placeholder in more developed teams or act as a utility support in early to mid-game. For artifacts, the **Emblem of Severed Fate** set is the best choice, increasing Energy Recharge and scaling Elemental Burst damage based on how much Recharge the Traveler has. A 2-piece mix of Emblem and Thundering Fury or Noblesse Oblige can also work well depending on whether you're leaning into damage or team support. For main stats, prioritize Energy Recharge on the Sands, Electro Damage Bonus on the Goblet, and Crit Rate or Crit Damage on the Circlet. Sub-stats should aim for more Energy Recharge and Crit for balanced output. When it comes to weapons, the **Favonius Sword** is a top-tier choice because it increases Energy generation for the entire team and complements their role as a battery. **Sacrificial Sword** is also great—it gives you a chance to reset the Elemental Skill cooldown and effectively doubles the number of Energy-restoring amulets you can generate. If you’re looking for a more offensive route, **Amenoma Kageuchi** provides Energy generation and some solid attack stats, especially if you're crafting free-to-play weapons. The Electro Traveler’s constellations are relatively easy to obtain and enhance their utility nicely. Constellation 1 increases the number of Abundance Amulets, improving energy generation. Constellation 2 increases the Energy gained from the amulets, further pushing their battery role. Later constellations improve Burst damage and Electro resistance shred, which can help in longer fights or when trying to maximize Electro DPS potential. At C6, they become a surprisingly competent support, offering a mix of utility, energy management, and off-field Electro damage. Overall, while the Electro Traveler may not rival the top-tier supports or Electro DPS units in raw power, they are dependable and highly practical, especially for players without fully built rosters. They shine as a flexible support character with reliable Electro application, excellent energy regeneration, and enough off-field presence to keep your team's flow running smoothly. Whether you're just arriving in Inazuma or looking for an adaptable battery, the Electro Traveler is well worth building.

question: Tell me about Xianyun
answer: Xianyun is a five-star Anemo character who wields a catalyst and stands out in Genshin Impact as a rare example of an Anemo healer and support with a heavy emphasis on aerial mobility and plunge-attack synergy. Inspired by the legendary Cloud Retainer from Liyue lore, Xianyun brings grace, elegance, and the spirit of an adeptus into battle, using her cloud-summoning abilities to support her team both defensively and offensively. Her kit is uniquely tailored to enhance characters that rely on plunging attacks, creating a niche team dynamic that rewards vertical combat and airborne aggression. Xianyun’s playstyle centers around her Elemental Skill and Burst, both of which support teammates and facilitate aerial movement. Her Elemental Skill, White Clouds at Dawn, allows her to leap into the air, granting plunging opportunities and healing based on her attack stat. The skill can be used up to three times in a row, enabling high mobility and creating a platform for plunge-attack-based characters. Her Elemental Burst, Stars Gather at Dusk, summons Cloudfall Skystacks that continuously heal nearby characters and boost their plunge damage, particularly if the team includes an Anemo character. This makes her a perfect support unit for teams focused around characters like Xiao or even more experimental builds like plunging Noelle or certain traveler setups. In team compositions, Xianyun shines brightest when paired with Xiao, whom she was practically made to support. Xiao’s kit revolves entirely around his plunging attacks, and Xianyun enables him to stay in the air longer, heals him to offset the HP drain from his Burst, and buffs his plunge damage through her own abilities. She also works well with Faruzan to create a triple Anemo core that maximizes Anemo damage while leaving room for a shielder or buffer like Zhongli or Bennett. Outside of Xiao, Xianyun can be used with other characters who benefit from aerial setups, though the synergy isn’t always as natural. When it comes to artifact sets, Xianyun’s best option is the four-piece Vourukasha’s Glow, which increases healing and boosts skill and burst damage after taking damage or healing, synergizing well with her healing-centric kit. Alternatively, Noblesse Oblige can be used to boost the team’s overall attack, especially if another team member isn't using it already. For main stats, you’ll want to focus on ATK% for the Sands, Anemo Damage Bonus or HP% on the Goblet depending on build, and Crit Rate/Crit Damage or Healing Bonus on the Circlet. Building her with high ATK is ideal if you want to maximize both her healing output and her plunge damage buffs. Xianyun has several good weapon options. Her signature five-star weapon, Crane’s Echoing Call, is best in slot, increasing her healing and providing buffs to plunge attack damage. If you don't have access to her signature weapon, Prototype Amber is an excellent free-to-play alternative that enhances healing and restores energy. Favonius Codex can also be used if energy generation is a priority, though it contributes less to her overall healing or support potential. Since she scales heavily off of attack, even a weapon like Skyward Atlas can work in hybrid builds, but her best performance is with those that directly support healing or plunging synergies. Xianyun’s constellations significantly enhance her support capabilities and flexibility. Her first constellation increases the number of Elemental Skill charges and boosts her healing further, allowing her to keep characters like Xiao alive and constantly airborne. Later constellations improve her energy generation and further increase the damage boost she gives to plunge attacks. Her sixth constellation turns her into a partial DPS by allowing her to unleash damage through coordinated attacks, but she’s already a fully functional and valuable support at C0, especially in Xiao teams. To sum it up, Xianyun is a beautiful fusion of elegance and utility—a character designed for a very specific purpose but with the versatility to fit into creative team comps. Her ability to heal, enhance plunge attacks, and create vertical combat opportunities adds a unique dimension to team-building in Genshin Impact. For players who love Xiao or want to explore more dynamic air-based combat styles, she is an invaluable and stylish support who transforms how your team interacts with the battlefield.

question: Tell me about Xiao
answer: Xiao is a five-star Anemo polearm user known for his high mobility and aggressive playstyle centered around plunging attacks. As a vigilant Yaksha and guardian of Liyue, his story is steeped in duty and solitude, but on the battlefield, he becomes a whirlwind of destruction. Xiao’s role is firmly that of a main DPS, and his kit is designed for sustained personal damage, allowing him to dominate the field with rapid, high-powered Anemo plunges that tear through groups of enemies and bosses alike. Xiao’s core mechanic lies in his Elemental Burst, Bane of All Evil, which transforms him into a demonic form that dramatically increases his jump height, converts his attacks to Anemo damage, and boosts his attack power. While in this state, he can spam plunging attacks that deal massive AoE Anemo damage. However, there’s a tradeoff—Xiao continually loses HP while his Burst is active, requiring a steady flow of healing to keep him alive. His Elemental Skill, Lemniscatic Wind Cycling, lets him dash forward in a flash of wind, damaging enemies in his path. This skill can be used up to three times in quick succession at higher constellations and is useful both for damage and repositioning. Xiao’s team composition needs to be carefully built around his strengths and weaknesses. Because he relies so heavily on his Elemental Burst and loses HP over time, pairing him with a good healer is essential. Characters like Jean or Bennett work beautifully—Jean, in particular, is ideal due to her Anemo synergy and strong healing. Faruzan is another excellent teammate, as she can shred enemy Anemo resistance and boost Xiao’s damage significantly. Zhongli is also a top-tier partner, offering a powerful shield and resistance shred to keep Xiao safe while he plunges into battle. Artifact-wise, Xiao’s best set is the four-piece Viridescent Venerer for early to mid-game players, but once you reach late game, a more optimal set is two pieces of Viridescent Venerer and two of Gladiator’s Finale or Shimenawa’s Reminiscence for an Anemo and ATK% mix. His main stats should focus on ATK% on the Sands, Anemo Damage Bonus on the Goblet, and Crit Rate or Crit Damage on the Circlet, depending on your weapon. Energy Recharge is also helpful, but not at the cost of damage—Xiao’s rotations are energy-hungry, but his damage ceiling is too high to sacrifice offensive stats completely. Xiao’s best weapon is the five-star polearm Primordial Jade Winged-Spear, which increases Crit Rate and boosts his attack after hitting enemies. Staff of Homa is another extremely powerful choice, especially since it benefits from the HP drain during his Burst and boosts Crit Damage. For four-star options, Deathmatch (from the Battle Pass) or Blackcliff Pole (from the Starglitter shop) are viable, especially when built with a proper Crit stat balance. Prototype Starglitter can be used if you're desperate for Energy Recharge, but it’s far from ideal for his damage-focused kit. Xiao’s constellations significantly enhance his quality of life and damage potential, though he’s perfectly viable at C0. His first constellation gives him an extra charge of his Elemental Skill, which smooths out his energy generation and adds more flexibility during combat. His second constellation increases his Energy Recharge, helping with uptime on his Burst. The most notable constellation is C6, which removes the cooldown on his Skill during his Burst, drastically increasing his damage output and mobility—but this is a luxury, not a necessity. In summary, Xiao is a dynamic and self-sufficient main DPS who rewards aggressive, fast-paced gameplay and excels at tearing through enemies with relentless plunging attacks. He does require specific support to function at his best, especially in terms of healing and energy generation, but when properly supported, he becomes one of the most devastating characters in the game. For players who enjoy high-impact, aerial combat and solo-carry style gameplay, Xiao is an incredibly satisfying and powerful choice.

question: Tell me about Yun jin
answer: Yun Jin is a unique four-star Geo character who wields a polearm and serves primarily as a support unit that boosts the Normal Attack damage of her teammates. As the head of the Yun-Han Opera Troupe in Liyue, she brings grace and elegance not just to the stage but also to the battlefield. Unlike many supports who enhance damage through elemental reactions, Yun Jin’s strength lies in her ability to buff allies regardless of their element or reaction potential, making her extremely versatile and especially powerful when paired with characters that rely heavily on Normal Attacks. Yun Jin’s playstyle is centered around her Elemental Skill and Burst, which work together to both protect her and enhance the damage output of the main DPS. Her Elemental Skill, Opening Flourish, allows her to enter a defensive stance and then unleash a counterattack based on her defense stat if timed correctly. While it does offer some utility, it’s her Elemental Burst, Cliffbreaker’s Banner, that defines her as a support. When activated, it grants all nearby party members a Normal Attack damage bonus based on Yun Jin’s defense and the number of different elements present in your party. This makes her an ideal partner for mono-element teams or those built around Normal Attack-centric characters. The best teammates for Yun Jin are those who deal most of their damage through Normal Attacks. Characters like Yoimiya, Ayato, Noelle (as DPS), and Razor benefit greatly from her buff. She also pairs well with characters like Fischl or Childe in specific setups. Since her buff does not rely on reactions or energy synergy, she fits comfortably into many team compositions and allows players to try out unique builds that aren’t reliant on traditional elemental reaction-based playstyles. For artifacts, the best set for Yun Jin is the Husk of Opulent Dreams, which significantly boosts her defense and Geo damage, both of which scale her Burst effectiveness. You can also use a two-piece combo of Defender’s Will and Husk for an early-game or budget option. Her main stats should focus on Energy Recharge on the Sands, DEF% on the Goblet, and DEF% or Crit Rate/Crit Damage on the Circlet depending on the weapon and playstyle. Energy Recharge is also important because you want to use her Burst frequently to keep the buff active. When it comes to weapons, Yun Jin performs best with polearms that provide Energy Recharge or DEF. The Favonius Lance is a great four-star option, helping her maintain high uptime on her Burst. Prototype Starglitter is a good craftable option, and if you have it, Engulfing Lightning is excellent for increasing Energy Recharge and boosting her Burst frequency. You can also use The Catch if you’re running her in more Burst-focused comps, though it may be overkill depending on the rest of your team. Yun Jin’s constellations offer strong quality-of-life improvements and enhance her supportive abilities. Her first constellation increases her Normal Attack buff uptime, while her second one increases her Burst's effectiveness. The most impactful one is her sixth constellation, which increases the Normal Attack Speed of your teammates when under her Burst’s effect, adding a significant damage boost in the right hands. However, she works well even at C0, and players don’t need to chase constellations unless they’re looking to optimize her performance or use her as a staple in multiple teams. In short, Yun Jin is a powerful and elegant support character whose unique defense-scaling mechanics and universal Normal Attack buff open up interesting and flexible team compositions. While she doesn’t deal massive damage on her own, her presence greatly amplifies the output of the right DPS characters, making her an excellent choice for players looking to build around Normal Attack-heavy playstyles or who enjoy mixing creativity into their team building.

question: Tell me about Venti
answer: Venti is one of the original five-star characters in Genshin Impact and is an incredibly powerful and versatile Anemo (Wind) support character who wields a bow. As the mortal vessel of Barbatos, the Anemo Archon of Mondstadt, Venti brings a light-hearted, poetic charm to the story, often seen singing or causing mischief. But beyond his carefree demeanor lies a very potent crowd control specialist, making him one of the strongest supports in the game, particularly in battles involving large groups of enemies. Venti’s playstyle revolves around his Elemental Skill and Burst, which allow him to gather enemies into a small area, enabling your other characters to deal massive area-of-effect (AoE) damage. His Elemental Skill, Skyward Sonnet, has two forms: a tap version that launches enemies into the air and a charged version that lifts Venti himself with an upcurrent. However, it’s his Elemental Burst, Wind’s Grand Ode, that truly defines his combat utility. This ability summons a massive Stormeye that continuously pulls in enemies and absorbs elements like Pyro, Cryo, Electro, or Hydro if they come into contact with it, creating swirling reactions that amplify your team’s elemental damage output significantly. When building a team around Venti, you’ll want to pair him with characters that can capitalize on the grouping effect of his Burst. Characters like Xiangling, Ayaka, or Ganyu can dish out devastating AoE damage that synergizes perfectly with Venti’s crowd control. His Swirl reactions also reduce enemy resistances with the right artifact set, further boosting team DPS. He works particularly well in mob-heavy content like the Spiral Abyss, though he can struggle slightly against heavy or boss-type enemies that cannot be pulled by his Burst. In terms of artifact sets, the Viridescent Venerer set is by far the best choice for Venti. It boosts Anemo damage and significantly enhances Swirl reactions while reducing enemy resistance to the swirled element, making your elemental DPS characters hit much harder. For main stats, you’ll want to focus on Energy Recharge or Elemental Mastery on the Sands, Anemo Damage Bonus on the Goblet, and Crit Rate or Crit Damage on the Circlet, depending on the weapon you choose. If you build him with Elemental Mastery, you’ll maximize his Swirl damage; if you go the crit route, you can take more advantage of his Anemo damage directly. Venti has several strong weapon options. His best-in-slot weapon is the five-star bow Elegy for the End, which boosts Energy Recharge and provides an Elemental Mastery buff to the team after triggering Elemental Reactions. It complements his supportive role beautifully. Other solid choices include The Stringless, which boosts Elemental Skill and Burst damage, and Favonius Warbow, which helps with energy generation. For a free-to-play option, Windblume Ode is viable, especially with an Elemental Mastery build. Venti's constellations are not necessary for him to function well—he's incredibly strong even at C0—but they do offer some fun bonuses. His first constellation restores energy for Venti and other party members after using his Burst, which can help in tight rotations. Higher constellations improve his crowd control and damage, but since he’s already top-tier out of the gate, most players don’t need to invest in them unless they’re fans or want to maximize his potential. Overall, Venti is an essential asset for players who enjoy efficient crowd control and setting up high-damage elemental reactions. He offers an elegant and smooth playstyle, sweeping enemies into the sky while your team rains devastation down on them. For new players, investing in Venti means ensuring a much easier time dealing with large groups of enemies throughout the game.
